text: {| class="wikitable";' align=right width="244px" |- | align=left style="background:#DDAA22"| << | align=center style="background:#DDAA22"| Ogrohayon | align=right style="background:#DDAA22"| >> |- |colspan="3" style="text-align: center;" |240px |- |colspan="3" style="text-align: center; font-size: 80%;" |In Bangladesh Ogrohayon is celebrated as the month of the main rice harvest of the year |}Ogrohayon ( Ôgrôhayôn) or alternately spelled Agrahayan is the eighth month in the Bengali calendar. It is the second of the two months that make up the Dry season, locally called "Hemanta" ( Hemôntô). It is commonly believed that this month is very auspicious for marriage. == Etymology == The month is named after the star Mrigashīra ( Mrigôshira). == Festival == The first day of the month is the Nabanna harvest festival. == Events == * Mahesh Chandra Nyayratna Bhattacharyya was born 17 Agrahayan in 1265. == References == Category:Months of the Bengali calendar
title: Ogrohayon
